tables.name: BankAccount
tables.description:
A Bank Account is an account that holds funds in a bank and is subject to deposits and withdrawals.Remark: 
 Filter: Only 'Eq' is supported as logical operator. 
 Integrity Conditions: 
 The following combinations of properties for filtering are allowed: 
 a.) by Bank Account ID 
 - ID (mandatory) 
 - CurrencyCode (optional) 
 - BankRoutingID (optional) 
 - BankCountryCode (optional) 
 No other filter attributes are allowed. 
 b.) by Bank Account Standard ID 
 - StandardID (mandatory) 
 - CurrencyCode (optional) 
 c.) by BankAccountContractUUID 
 - BankAccountContractUUID (mandatory) 
 d.) by Bank Account Contract ID 
 - BankAccountContractID (mandatory)

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A UUID is a universal unique identifier of a bank account. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: InternalID
columns.description: InternalID is a bank internal identifier for the bank account. Example: D4E088A52D5B1ED8BEE3FA163E6B7DE1

columns.name: ID
columns.description:
Bank account number (Basic Bank Account Number, BBAN). An account number that is assigned by the account managing bank. 
It uniquely identifies a bank account in most countries only together with BankRoutingID and BankCountryCode. Example: 0010000707

columns.name: StandardID
columns.description: International bank account number (International Bank Account Number, IBAN). Example: DE65904199170010000707

columns.name: CurrencyCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the currency of the bank account. Example: EUR

columns.name: BankRoutingID
columns.description: Number of the bank in a clearing system (see GDT BankRoutingID). Example: 90419917

columns.name: BankCountryCode
columns.description:
Country in which the bank identified earlier goes about its business. 
If the bank is a member in a national clearing system, the country to which this clearing system belongs is entered here. Example: DE

columns.name: BankAccountContractUUID
columns.description: A bank internal identifier for the bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: BankAccountContractID
columns.description: An identifier for a BankAccountContract.

tables.name: BankAccountContractCancelRequest
tables.description: A Bank Account Contract Cancel Request is a request from the account holder party to the bank to cancel a current account contract or a savings account contract immediately or at a future time.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A UUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank account contract cancel request. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: ID is an identifier of the Bank Account Contract Cancel Request. Example: 761

columns.name: BankAccountContractUUID
columns.description: A BankAccountContractUUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: A ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 2019-06-04T08:29:04Z

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A LifeCycleStatusCode is the coded representation of the life cycle status of a BankAccountContractCancelRequest. Example: 3

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: A LifeCycleStatusName is the name of a LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: ReasonCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the reason for the BankAccountContractCancelRequest. Example: 107

columns.name: ReasonName
columns.description: ReasonName is the name of a ReasonCode. Example: Other

columns.name: ImmediateCompletionRequiredIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether immediate completion of the bank account contract cancel request is required or not.

columns.name: ReceiptDate
columns.description: A ReceiptDate is the date on which the request for canceling the bank account contract is received. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: PlannedCompletionDate
columns.description: A PlannedCompletionDate is the date for which the completion of the bank account contract cancel request is planned. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: CompletionDate
columns.description: A CompletionDate is the date on which the request for canceling the bank account contract is completed. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: BankAccountSettlementRequiredIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether a bank account settlement is required for a bank account contract cancel request or not.

columns.name: BankAccountSettlementRequestedValueDate
columns.description: Is the value date requested for settlement of the bank account associated with the cancelled bank account contract. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: CancellationReasonCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the reason for the cancelation of a CurrentAccountContractCancelRequest. Example: 000003

columns.name: CancellationReasonName
columns.description: A BankAccountContractCancelRequestCancellationReasonName is the name of a BankAccountContractCancelRequestCancellationReasonCode. Example: Customer Request

columns.name: BankAccountSettlementCancellationRequiredIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether or not a cancelation of a bank account settlement is required for the cancelation of a bank account contract cancel request.

columns.name: CancellationDate
columns.description: A CancellationDate is the date on which the request for canceling the current account contract is cancelled. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ResidualBankAccountBalanceAmount
columns.description: The residual balance of the bank account, before it is balanced by cash or by payment to payment transaction instruction.

columns.name: CancellationChargeAmount
columns.description: The charge amount for cancelation of the bank account contract.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: BalancingByCashIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether amount resulting from balancing the bank account associated with bank account contract cancellation is requested as payment by cash or not.

columns.name: BalancingPaymentTransactionInstruction
columns.description: BalancingPaymentTransactionInstruction specifies the payment transaction instruction for balancing the residual balance of the bank account associated with the bank account contract.

tables.name: BankAccountContractLockRequest
tables.description: A bank account contract lock request is a request to maintain locks on product features and transactions of bank account contract.Bank account contract is a view of a bank contract.

columns.name: ID
columns.description: Is an identifier of a bank account contract lock request. Example: 105

columns.name: BankAccountContractUUID
columns.description: An universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: An unique identifier of a bank account contract lock request for a change state. Example: 2019-07-13T13:34:46Z

columns.name: EventCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the event of a bank contract lock request. Example: 4841

columns.name: EventName
columns.description: Name of EventCode. Example: Debit Card Lock (for Account)

columns.name: UserStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the user status of a bank contract lock request. Example: 2

columns.name: UserStatusName
columns.description: Name of UserStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: ValidityStartDate
columns.description: The validity start date for a bank contract lock request. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ValidityEndDate
columns.description: The validity end date for a bank contract lock request. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: Note
columns.description: A note on bank contract lock request about the lock. Example: Customer deceased April 01, 2019

tables.name: BankAccountContract
tables.description: Bank Account Contract is a contract between a credit institute and customer, which is based on the customer's request for opening a bank account and consists among others, the bank account type, account holder, general terms and conditions.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A UUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An identifier of a bank account contract.

columns.name: TypeCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the type of a bank account contract. Example: 874

columns.name: TypeName
columns.description: Name of TypeCode. Example: Current Account Contract

columns.name: SubTypeCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the sub type of a bank account contract. Example: 1

columns.name: SubTypeName
columns.description: Name of SubTypeCode. Example: Current Account Contract

columns.name: GroupCode
columns.description: A coded representation of a group of bank account contracts. Example: 0030

columns.name: GroupName
columns.description: Name of GroupCode. Example: Current Accounts

columns.name: CurrencyCode
columns.description: A CurrencyCode specifies the currency of the bank account contract. Example: EUR

columns.name: BankAccountIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A BankAccount is a bank account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank account contract. Example: 2

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: DormancyStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the dormancy status of a bank account contract. Example: 01

columns.name: DormancyStatusName
columns.description: Name of DormancyStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: Product
columns.description: A Product describes the (financial) product upon which the bank account contract is based.

columns.name: AccountHolderPartyIdfgElmnts
columns.description: A party which legally holds a Bank Account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: UsageNote
columns.description: A comment on the usage of the bank account contract. Example: USAGENOTE

columns.name: StartDate
columns.description: Date when the bank account contract becomes operational from the customer's point of view. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ActualCancellationDate
columns.description: Date when a bank account contract is actually canceled. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: PlannedCancellationDate
columns.description: Date when a cancellation of a bank account contract is planned. Example: 2017-04-13

tables.name: BankAccountContractPaymentTransactionOrderRequest
tables.description: Request for a payment transaction for a order bank account contract.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: Universally unique identifier for a bank account contract payment transaction order request. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An indentifier for a bank account contract payment transaction order request. Example: 0001-123456

columns.name: BankAccountUUID
columns.description: A UUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank account. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: RequesterBACPaymentTransactionOrderRequestID
columns.description: An identifier for a bank account contract payment transaction order request issued by the requester of the BankAccountContractPaymentTransactionOrderRequest. Example: Xample-RequestID

columns.name: PaymentTransactionReferenceID
columns.description: A reference number for a transaction in payment transactions. Example: Xample-ReferenceID

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: An identifier for a change status. Example: 20210126091744.5563510

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: Coded representation of the life cycle status of a BankAccountContractPaymentTransactionOrderRequest. Example: 1

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of a life cycle status. Example: Active

columns.name: BankAccountPostingDate
columns.description: Specifies the date when the sender item is posted to the corresponding bank account. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: PlannedExecutionDate
columns.description: Date on which a bank account contract payment transaction order request is planned to be executed. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: BankAccountValueDate
columns.description: Specifies the date on which a posted sender item is relevant for interest calculation. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: TransactionCurrencyAmount
columns.description: Amount in the transaction currency of a business transaction.

columns.name: BankAccountCurrencyAmount
columns.description: Amount in the currency of a bank account.

columns.name: SenderItem
columns.description: Represents the sending side of the payment transaction.

columns.name: RecipientItem
columns.description: Represents the receiving side of the payment transaction.

columns.name: MaterialChecksDeactivationRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether deactivation of the all material checks is requested for processing the bank account payment entries  on the sender and the recipient account of the bank account contract payment transaction order request.

columns.name: PostOrCancelRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether it is requested that the payment transaction order request shall only be accepted by the system if the bank account payment entries for the sender and recipient account can be posted. Otherwise, the payment transaction order request shall be rejected.

columns.name: MoreRecipientsAvailableIndicator
columns.description: Indicates that the payment transaction order requests has more than one recipient.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

tables.name: BankAccountContractAccountHolderChangeRequest
tables.description: A Bank Account Contract Account Holder Change Request is a request to change the account holder of a current account contract or savings account contract or time deposit contract immediately.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: UUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank account contract account holder change request. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: ID is an identifier of a bank account contract account holder change request. Example: 47938

columns.name: BankAccountContractUUID
columns.description: BankAccountContractUUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 20200309121401.6154150

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: LifeCycleStatusCode is the coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank account contract account holder change request. Example: 3

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Is the name of LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Completed

columns.name: ReasonCode
columns.description: ReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the bank account contract account holder change request. Example: 5

columns.name: ReasonName
columns.description: Is the name of ReasonCode Example: Marriage

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: BusinessProcessChainAssignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: NewAccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: NewAccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements is a party that legally holds a bank account associated with the bank account contract after completion of the account holder change request.

columns.name: FormerAccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: FormerAccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements is a party that legally holds a bank account associated with the current account contract or savings account contract before completion of the account holder change request.

columns.name: ChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator
columns.description: ChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator indicates whether a charge for activation of a bank account contract account holder change request is requested to be waived or not.

columns.name: CompletionDate
columns.description: The CompletionDate is the date on which a bank account contract account holder change request is completed. Example: 2017-04-13

tables.name: BankAccountPrenoteEntry
tables.description: A Bank Account Prenote Entry represents a reservation on a Bank Account for either a debit or a credit amount.  A Bank Account is an account that holds funds in a bank and is subject to deposits and withdrawals.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: Is the unique identifier for a bank account prenote entry. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: BankAccountUUID
columns.description: A BankAccountUUID is an universal unique identifier for the bank account to which the entry is assigned. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: RequesterBankAccountPrenoteEntryID
columns.description: Identifies a bank account prenote entry and is assigned by the requester of the bank account prenote entry. Example: PRENOTE-REFERENCE-4711

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: Identifies a change state. Example: 2019-06-04T08:29:04Z

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: Coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank account prenote entry. Example: 5

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of a LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Discarded

columns.name: TypeCode
columns.description: Coded representation of a type of bank account prenote entry. Example: 30

columns.name: TypeName
columns.description: Name of a TypeCode. Example: Payment Advice - Debit

columns.name: RejectionReasonCode
columns.description: A coded representation of reason for reject of a bank account prenote entry. Example: 01

columns.name: RejectionReasonName
columns.description: A name of a RejectionReasonCode. Example: Insufficient Funds

columns.name: BankPaymentCommunicationChannelCode
columns.description: Coded representation of the communication channel for payments in a bank. Example: 3

columns.name: BankPaymentCommunicationChannelName
columns.description: Name of a BankPaymentCommunicationChannel. Example: EFT

columns.name: ValidityStartDate
columns.description: Date on which the bank account prenote entry becomes valid. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: PlannedValidityEndDate
columns.description: Date on which the validity of a bank acocunt prenote entry is planned to end. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ValidityEndDate
columns.description: Date on which the validity of the bank account prenote entry ends. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: BankAccountDebitIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the bank account will be debited by the bank account prenote entry or not.

columns.name: BankAccountAvailableAmountRelevanceIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the bank account prenote entry is relevant for the calculation of the available amount of the bank account or not.

columns.name: LimitCheckDeactivationRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether deactivation of limit check was requested for processing the bank account prenote entry.

columns.name: AdditionalMaterialChecksDeactivationRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether deactivation of the all material checks (except limit check) is requested for processing the bank account prenote entry.

columns.name: ValidIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the bank account prenote entry is valid or not.

columns.name: Note
columns.description: A note about a bank account prenote entry. Example: Long Text

columns.name: AdditionalNote
columns.description: An additional note about a bank account prenote entry. Example: Short Text

columns.name: MaterialCheckNote
columns.description: A note for processing customer owned checks for a prenote entry. Example: Material Check Note

columns.name: MaterialCheckAdditionalNote
columns.description: An additional note for processing customer owned checks for a prenote entry. Example: AdChNt

columns.name: BankAccountCurrencyAmount
columns.description: Amount in the currency of a bank account.

columns.name: TransactionCurrencyAmount
columns.description: Amount in the currency of a business transaction.

columns.name: Reference
columns.description: References of the bank account prenote entry.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: The Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a bank prenote entry to a business process chain.

tables.name: BankCardContract
tables.description: A Bank Card Contract is a contract between a financial institution and customer that is based on the customerâ€™s request to have a bank card issued.

columns.name: BankCardContractUUID
columns.description: A BankCardContractUUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank card contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An identifier of a bank card contract.

columns.name: CurrencyCode
columns.description: A CurrencyCode specifies the currency of the bank card contract. Example: EUR

columns.name: PaymentCardTypeCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the type of payment card associated to a bank card contract. Example: 0010

columns.name: PaymentCardTypeName
columns.description: Name of PaymentCardTypeCode Example: Debit Card

columns.name: PaymentCardID
columns.description: PaymentCardID is a unique identifier of a payment card that is assigned by the issuer of the payment card. Example: 4111555533336666

columns.name: PaymentCardSequenceID
columns.description: An identifier for the sequence number of a payment card. Example: 0001

columns.name: PaymentCardValidFrom
columns.description: The valid-from date of the payment card. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: PaymentCardValidTo
columns.description: The valid-to date of the payment card. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: PaymentCardCharacterCode
columns.description: A coded representation for the character of a payment card associated to a bank card contract. Example: 1

columns.name: PaymentCardCharacterName
columns.description: Name of PaymentCardCharacterCode Example: First Payment Card

columns.name: FirstPaymentCardUUID
columns.description: The UUID of the payment card, which has PaymentCardOriginCode = First Card Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: AdditionalPaymentCardIndicator
columns.description: Indicates that the payment card is an additional payment card to the main payment card.

columns.name: PaymentCardLifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank card contract payment card. Example: 1

columns.name: PaymentCardLifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of PaymentCardLifeCycleStatusCode Example: Active

columns.name: PaymentCardRenewalStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation for the renewal status of a payment card associated to a bank card contract. Example: 4

columns.name: PaymentCardRenewalStatusName
columns.description: Name of PaymentCardRenewalStatusCode Example: Renewed

columns.name: CancellationDate
columns.description: Date when a bank card contract is canceled. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: BankAccount
columns.description: BankAccount is the main bank account to which payments and charges in context with using the payment card are settled.

columns.name: UsageNote
columns.description: A comment on the usage of the bank card contract. Example: Sample Usage Note

columns.name: SystemAdministrativeData
columns.description: SystemAdministrativeData is administrative data that is stored in a system. This data includes change dates and change times.

columns.name: CardHolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A party which legally holds a card associated with the bank card contract.

columns.name: ProductControl
columns.description: A BankCardContractProductionControl defines the parameters that control the processing and handling in the production of a bank card contract.

columns.name: OperationalBankContractManagement
columns.description: An OperationalBankContractManagement is responsible for managing operational bank contracts and executing the related banking processes.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: A ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 20191122135035.7818490

tables.name: BankCardContractLockRequest
tables.description: A Bank Card Contract Lock Request is a request from the card holder party to the bank to lock a card contract immediately or at a future time.

columns.name: ID
columns.description: Is an identifier of a bank card contract lock request. Example: 105

columns.name: PartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: PartyIdentifyingElements contains all the identifying elements of a bank customer.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: An unique identifier of a bank card contract lock request for a change state. Example: 2019-07-13T13:34:46Z

columns.name: EventCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the event of a bank card contract lock request. Example: 103000

columns.name: EventName
columns.description: Name of EventCode. Example: Card Dispatch Lock

columns.name: UserStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the user status of a bank contract lock request. Example: 2

columns.name: UserStatusName
columns.description: Name of UserStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: ValidityStartDate
columns.description: The validity start date for a bank contract lock request. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ValidityEndDate
columns.description: The validity end date for a bank contract lock request. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: Note
columns.description: A note on bank contract lock request about the lock. Example: Customer permanently moved to another country

tables.name: BankCardContractLockRequestEventSpecification
tables.description: A Bank card contract lock request event specification is a specification of the possible events of a bank card contract lock request.

columns.name: EventCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the event of a bank card contract lock request. Example: 301000

columns.name: EventName
columns.description: Name of EventCode. Example: Debit Card Lock

tables.name: BankCreditFacilityContract
tables.description: Bank Credit Facility Contract is a frame contract that defines an overall credit line for a hierarchy of subordinated bank contracts.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A universal unique identifier of a Bank Credit Facility Contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An identifier for a Bank Master Contract of type Bank Credit Facility Contract. Example: 1234

columns.name: CurrencyCode
columns.description: Specifies the currency of a bank credit facility contract. Example: EUR

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank credit facility contract. Example: 1

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: Product
columns.description: Describes the (financial) product upon which the bank master contract is based.

columns.name: BusinessEventRecord
columns.description: A record of a business event that changes a bank master contract.

columns.name: HolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: Is a party that legally holds a Bank Master Contract.

columns.name: OperationalBankContractManagement
columns.description: Is responsible for managing operational bank contracts andexecuting the related banking processes.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Is the assignment of a bank credit facility contract to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: A ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 20191122135035.7818490

columns.name: SubordinatedBankContractNumberValue
columns.description: A number of subordinated bank contracts of one level below. Example: 3

columns.name: Limits
columns.description: A maximum preset amount of the credit line defined by a bank credit facility contract.

tables.name: BankCustomerLockRequest
tables.description: A bank customer lock request is a request to maintain locks on product features and transactions of all bank account contract of a bank customer.

columns.name: ID
columns.description: Is an identifier of a bank customer lock request. Example: 105

columns.name: PartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: The party identifying elements of the bank customer.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: An unique identifier of a bank customer lock request for a change state. Example: 2019-07-13T13:34:46Z

columns.name: EventCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the event of a bank contract lock request. Example: 103000

columns.name: EventName
columns.description: Name of EventCode. Example: Negative Credit Rating

columns.name: UserStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the user status of a bank contract lock request. Example: 2

columns.name: UserStatusName
columns.description: Name of UserStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: ValidityStartDate
columns.description: The validity start date for a bank contract lock request. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ValidityEndDate
columns.description: The validity end date for a bank contract lock request. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: Note
columns.description: A note on bank contract lock request about the lock. Example: Customer deceased April 01, 2019

tables.name: CurrentAccountContract
tables.description:
A Current Account Contract is a contract between a credit institute and customer, which is based on the customer's request for opening a bank account of type current account and consists among others, account holder, general terms and conditions.

Comment: A bank account based on a current account contract is an account that allows money to be held on behalf of the account holder

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: An universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An identifier of a bank account contract.

columns.name: CurrencyCode
columns.description: A CurrencyCode specifies the currency of the bank account contract. Example: EUR

columns.name: BankAccountIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A BankAccount is a bank account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank account contract. Example: 2

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: DormancyStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the dormancy status of a bank account contract. Example: 01

columns.name: DormancyStatusName
columns.description: Name of DormancyStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: UsageNote
columns.description: A comment on the usage of the current account contract.

columns.name: SystemAdministrativeData
columns.description: SystemAdministrativeData is administrative data that is stored in a system. This data includes change dates and change times.

columns.name: AccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A party which legally holds a Bank Account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: Product
columns.description: A Product describes the (financial) product upon which the bank account contract is based.

columns.name: BusinessEventRecord
columns.description: A record of a business event that changes a bank account contract.

columns.name: OperationalBankContractManagement
columns.description: An OperationalBankContractManagement is responsible for managing operational bank contracts and executing the related banking processes.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: A ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 20191122135035.7818490

columns.name: CreateDraftRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the current account contract shall be created with life cycle status code 'Draft Entered'.

tables.name: DirectDebitMandate
tables.description: A Direct Debit Mandate is the authorisation given by a debtor to a creditor to initiate instructions to debit funds owed to the creditor from a specified account, and the authorisation to the debtor bank to comply with the instructions issued by the creditor.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: Is a universal unique identifier of a direct debit mandate. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: A identifier of Direct Debit Mandate. Example: TEST1234

columns.name: CreditorPartyID
columns.description: A unique identifier of a creditor party of direct debit mandate. Example: DE123452345678901

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: Identifies a change state. Example: 2019-06-04T08:29:04Z

columns.name: UserStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the user status of a direct debit mandate. Example: 2

columns.name: UserStatusName
columns.description: Name of UserStatusCode. Example: Mandate - Active

columns.name: SignatureDate
columns.description: Time Point at which a signature for direct debit mandate is given. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: SignatureCityName
columns.description: Name of the city where the signature for a direct debit mandate is given. Example: Berlin

columns.name: ValidityPeriod
columns.description: Period for which the direct debit mandate is valid.

columns.name: DirectDebitSchemeCode
columns.description: A coded representation of a direct debit scheme. A direct debit scheme is a set of rules and obligations regarding the collection of direct debit payments. Example: 1

columns.name: DirectDebitSchemeName
columns.description: Name of DirectDebitSchemeCode.  Example: SEPA Core

columns.name: DirectDebitCollectionSEPASequenceTypeCode
columns.description: A coded representation of a SEPA sequence type of a direct debit collection. A SEPA sequence type specifies a type of direct debit collection for which the direct debit mandate is issued.  Example: RCUR

columns.name: DirectDebitCollectionSEPASequenceTypeName
columns.description: Name of DirectDebitCollectionSEPASequenceTypeCode.  Example: Recurring

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: The assignment of a direct debit mandate to a business process chain.

columns.name: RelatedCreditorParty
columns.description: A party that is related with the creditor party.

columns.name: CreditorParty
columns.description: Creditor party of the direct debit mandate.

columns.name: OriginalCreditorParty
columns.description: Creditor party for whom the direct debit mandate is originally given.The CreditorParty acts on behalf of OriginalCreditorParty.

columns.name: RelatedDebtorPartyID
columns.description: A party that is related with the debtor party.

columns.name: DebtorParty
columns.description: Debtor party of the direct debit mandate.

columns.name: FinalDebtorParty
columns.description: Debtor party of the direct debit mandate that is finally debited.

columns.name: DebtorBankAccount
columns.description: Bank account of the debtor.

columns.name: CreditorReferenceID
columns.description: An identifier for a direct debit mandate creditor reference

columns.name: CreditorReferenceDescription
columns.description: A description for a direct debit mandate creditor reference.

Constraint:LoanContractCreate-Duringcreationofaloancontract,itisrequiredtospecifythedetailsofTermAgreementandInpaymentAgreement.

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName

columns.name: BorrowerPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: ABorrowerPartyisapartywhotakesupafinancialinstrument,inthiscasealoancontract.

columns.name: Product
columns.description: AProductdescribesthe(financial)productuponwhichthebankaccountcontractisbased.

columns.name: BusinessEventRecord
columns.description: Arecordofabusinesseventthatchangesabankaccountcontract.

columns.name: OperationalBankContractManagement
columns.description: AnOperationalBankContractManagementisresponsibleformanagingoperationalbankcontractsandexecutingtherelatedbankingprocesses.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: BusinessProcessChainAssignmentistheassignmentofabusinessobjectnodetoabusinessprocesschain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: AChangeStateIDisauniqueidentifierforachangestate. Example: 20191122135035.7818490

columns.name: ClearingBankAccountContract
columns.description: AClearingBankAccountContractisaBankAccountContractthatreceivesincomingpaymentsthathavetobetransferredtoaspecificloancontract.

columns.name: TermSpecification
columns.description: Aspecificationoftermelementsthataffectsalltermagreementsoftheloancontract.

tables.name: LoanContractBorrowerPartyChangeRequest
tables.description: A LoanContractBorrowerPartyChangeRequest is a request to change the borrower of a loan contract immediately.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: UUID is an universal unique identifier of a loan contract borrower party change request. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: ID is an identifier of a loan contract borrower party change request. Example: 47938

columns.name: LoanContractUUID
columns.description: An internal ID of Loan Contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: Identifies a change state. Example: 20200309121401.6154150

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: LifeCycleStatusCode is the coded representation of the life cycle status of a loan contract borrower party change request. Example: 3

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of a LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Completed

columns.name: ReasonCode
columns.description: ReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the loan contract borrower party change request. Example: 1

columns.name: ReasonName
columns.description: Is the name of the reason code Example: Change of legal  form

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: BusinessProcessChainAssignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: NewBorrowerPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: NewBorrowerPartyIdentifyingElements is a party that legally holds a bank account associated with the loan contract after completion of the borrower party change request.

columns.name: FormerBorrowerPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: FormerBorrowerPartyIdentifyingElements is a party that legally holds a bank account associated with the loan contract before completion of the borrower party change request.

columns.name: NewClearingBankAccountContractUUID
columns.description: NewClearingBankAccountContractUUID is an universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator
columns.description: ChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator indicates whether a charge for activation of a loan contract borrower party change request is requested to be waived or not.

columns.name: CompletionDate
columns.description: The CompletionDate is the date on which a loan contract borrower party change request is completed. Example: 2017-04-13

tables.name: LoanContractPayoffRequest
tables.description: A Loan Contract Payoff Request is a request from the borrower to a lender (financial institution) to pay off a loan contract.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A UUID is a  universal unique identifier of a LoanContractPayoffRequest. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An ID is an identifier of the LoanContractPayoffRequest. Example: 71

columns.name: LoanContractUUID
columns.description: An internal ID of Loan Contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: Identifies a change state. Example: 20200309121401.6154150

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A LifeCycleStatusCode is the coded representation of the life cycle status of a LoanContractPayoffRequest. Example: 5

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of a LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Completed

columns.name: ReasonCode
columns.description: A ReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the payoff. Example: 1

columns.name: ReasonName
columns.description: Is the name of the reason code Example: Borrower Decision

columns.name: CancellationReasonCode
columns.description: A CancellationReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the cancellation of a loan contract payoff request. Example: 1

columns.name: CancellationReasonName
columns.description: Is the name of a CancellationReasonCode. Example: Borrower Decision

columns.name: LoanPaymentPlanChangeTypeCode
columns.description: A LoanPaymentPlanChangeTypeCode is a coded representation of the type of a LoanPaymentPlanChange. Example: 1

columns.name: LoanPaymentPlanChangeTypeName
columns.description: Is the name of a LoanPaymentPlanChangeTypeCode. Example: Without Term End Change

columns.name: ValueDate
columns.description: A ValueDate is the value date of the payoff. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ExpectedPaymentDate
columns.description: An ExpectedPaymentDate is the date on which the payment to payoff of loan is expected. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: LastScheduledPaymentDate
columns.description: The date on which last scheduled payment is to be made before payoff. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: CompletionDate
columns.description: A Completion Date is the  date on which the loan contract payoff request is completed. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: DueDate
columns.description: A PayoffDueDate is the date on which the payoff  is due. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: FinalPaymentDate
columns.description: Indicates whether the bank account will be debited by the bank account prenote entry or not. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: NetAmount
columns.description: A NetAmount is the net amount of the loan contract payoff request.

columns.name: GrossAmount
columns.description: A GrossAmount is the gross amount of the loan contract payoff request

columns.name: DailyInterestAmount
columns.description: A DailyInterestAmount is the daily amount of the interest calculated for the value date of the loan contract payoff request.

columns.name: DailyInterestOnArrearsAmount
columns.description: A DailyInterestOnArrearsAmount is the daily amount of the interest on arrears calculated for the value date of the loan contract payoff request.

columns.name: ActivationChargeAmount
columns.description: An ActivationChargeAmount is the charge amount for activation.

columns.name: NewInstalmentAmount
columns.description: NewInstallmentAmount is the  installment amount after the LoanContractPayoff Request.

columns.name: ImmediateCompletionRequiredIndicator
columns.description: An ImmediateCompletionRequiredIndicator indicates whether immediate completion is required for a LoanContractPayoffRequest or not.

columns.name: FullPayoffRequiredIndicator
columns.description: A FullPayoffRequiredIndicator indicates whether a full payoff is required for a loan contract payoff or not.

columns.name: ActivationChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether a charge is applied for a activated loan contract payoff request or not.

columns.name: ImmediateCompletionChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether a charge is applied for immediate completion of  loan contract payoff request or not.

columns.name: EarlyRepaymentCompensationRequiredIndicator
columns.description: An EarlyRepaymentCompensationRequiredIndicator is an indicator of whether early repayment compensation is required or not.

columns.name: GrossAmountCalculationResult
columns.description: Gross Amount Calculation Result

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of Loan Contract Payoff Request to a business process chain.

columns.name: PaymentTransactionInstruction
columns.description: A Payment Transaction Instruction is an instruction for payment transactions related to the loan contract.

tables.name: LoanContractProlongationRequest
tables.description: A Loan Contract Prolongation Request is a request to extend one or multiple time-limited parts of the contractual relationship between the lender party and the borrower party.

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A UUID is a  universal unique identifier of a LoanContractProlongationRequest. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: ID is an identifier of the LoanContractProlongationRequest. Example: 71

columns.name: LoanContract
columns.description: The loan contract for which a loan contract prolongation request is made.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: Identifies a change state of a Loan Contract Prolongation Request. Example: 2019-06-03T06:16:41Z

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A LifeCycleStatusCode is the coded representation of the life cycle status of a LoanContractProlongationRequest. Example: 5

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of a LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Completed

columns.name: CancellationReasonCode
columns.description: A CancellationReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the cancellation of a Loan Contract Prolongation Request. Example: 10

columns.name: CancellationReasonName
columns.description: Name of a CancellationReasonCode. Example: Bank Request

columns.name: PenaltyRelevanceIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the penalty for the Loan Contract Prolongation Request is relevant or not.

columns.name: ActivationChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether a charge for activation of Loan Contract Prolongation Request is requested to be waived or not.

columns.name: LoanContractProlongationTermValidityEndDate
columns.description: Is the end date of validity of term after prolongation of the loan contract.  Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ActivationChargeAmount
columns.description: Is the activation charge amount.

columns.name: EarlyRepaymentCompensationAmount
columns.description: Is the amount of early repayment compensation.

columns.name: ReimbursementAmount
columns.description: Is the amount of reimbursement.

columns.name: LoanContractPaymentPlanPlannedBalanceAmount
columns.description: Is the planned balance of payments remaining in the payment plan of the  loan contract at the time of the LoanContractProlongationRequest.

columns.name: LoanContractPaymentPlanActualBalanceAmount
columns.description: Is the actual balance of payments remaining in the payment plan of the  loan contract at the time of the LoanContractProlongationRequest.

columns.name: FinalPaymentAmount
columns.description: Is the final installment amount(Balloon)  for a loan contract after this loan contract prolongation request.

columns.name: FinalPaymentDate
columns.description: Is the due date for FinalPaymentAmount after this loan contract prolongation request. Example: 2017-04-13

tables.name: LoanDisbursementRequest
tables.description: A LoanDisbursementRequest is a request from a borrower to a lender (credit institute) to transfer money from the loan contract to areceiving account at a specific time. The borrower or a loan officer can decide to withhold money from the gross disbursement amount topay due or expected items. Items can consist of installments or fees. Note :The sum of withhold items is returned during read of LoanDisbursementRequest

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: Is a universal unique identifier of a Loan Disbursement Request. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: Identifier of the LoanDisbursementRequest. Example: 47938

columns.name: LoanContractUUID
columns.description: A globally unique identifier for a LoanContract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: Identifies a change state. Example: 20200220054415.0000000

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: LifeCycleStatusCode is the coded representation of the life cycle status of a LoanDisbursementRequest. Example: 1

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of LifeCycleStatusCode Example: In Preparation

columns.name: ReasonCode
columns.description: ReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the LoanDisbursementRequest. Example: 1

columns.name: ReasonName
columns.description: Name of ReasonCode. Example: Customer Request

columns.name: CancellationReasonCode
columns.description: CancellationReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the cancellation of the LoanDisbursementRequest Example: 1

columns.name: CancellationReasonName
columns.description: Name of CancellationReasonCode Example: Error processing

columns.name: NetAmount
columns.description: NetAmount is the net amount of the disbursement.

columns.name: GrossAmount
columns.description: GrossAmount is the gross amount of the disbursement.

columns.name: BillingItemsWithheldAmount
columns.description: BillingItemsWithheldAmount is the sum of due amount of billing items withheld from the disbursement GrossAmount.

columns.name: ItemsWithheldAmount
columns.description: ItemsWithheldAmount is the sum of planned amount of items withheld from the disbursement GrossAmount

columns.name: ActivationChargeAmount
columns.description: An ActivationChargeAmount is the charge amount for activation.

columns.name: ValueDate
columns.description: ValueDate is the value date of the disbursement. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: PlannedPaymentDate
columns.description: PlannedPaymentDate is the planned payment date of the disbursement. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: ActivationChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether charges for activation of the loan disbursement request are requested to be waived.

columns.name: PaymentTransactionInstructionItems
columns.description: An item describes a single element of a BankContractPaymentTransactionInstruction.

tables.name: LoanPaymentSkipRequest
tables.description: A LoanPaymentSkipRequest is a request from a borrower to a lender (credit institute) to to skip one or more payments of the loan contract or skip payments for a specific period of the loan contract. Integrity Condition: Any one of the following filter is allowed: ID ,LoanContractUUID ,LoanContractUUID and LifeCycleStatusCode

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: A UUID is a  universal unique identifier of LoanPaymentSkipRequest. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: Identifier of the LoanPaymentSkipRequest. Example: 47938

columns.name: LoanContractUUID
columns.description: A globally unique identifier for a LoanContract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: Identifies a change state. Example: 20200220054415.0000000

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: LifeCycleStatusCode is the coded representation of the life cycle status of a LoanPaymentSkipRequest. Example: 3

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of LifeCycleStatusCode Example: Completed

columns.name: LoanPaymentPlanSkippedInstallmentPaymentModeCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the mode of payment of a skipped installment of the payment plan of a loan. Example: 1

columns.name: LoanPaymentPlanSkippedInstallmentPaymentModeName
columns.description: Name of LoanPaymentPlanSkippedInstallmentPaymentModeCode. Example: Term Change

columns.name: ReasonCode
columns.description: ReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the cancellation of the LoanPaymentSkipRequest. Example: 1

columns.name: ReasonName
columns.description: Name of ReasonCode. Example: Customer Request

columns.name: CancellationReasonCode
columns.description: CancellationReasonCode is the coded representation of the reason for the cancellation of the LoanPaymentSkipRequest.. Example: 1

columns.name: CancellationReasonName
columns.description: Name of CancellationReasonCode. Example: Error processing

columns.name: ActivationChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator
columns.description: ActivationChargeWaiverRequestedIndicator

columns.name: PreviousInstallmentAmount
columns.description: PreviousInstallmentAmount is the installmet amount before the LoanPaymentSkipRequest.

columns.name: NewInstallmentAmount
columns.description: NewInstallmentAmount is the installment amount after the LoanPaymentSkipRequest.

columns.name: NewInstallmentStartDate
columns.description: NewInstallmentStartDate is the calender date on which the new installment starts. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: FinalInstallmentAmount
columns.description: FinalInstallmentAmount is the last installment amount for a loan contract.

columns.name: FinalPaymentDate
columns.description: FinalPaymentDate is the due date for FinalInstallmentAmount. Example: 2017-04-13

columns.name: SkipDatePeriod
columns.description: SkipDatePeriod is the period for which payments to be skipped.

tables.name: SavingsAccountContract
tables.description:
A Savings Account Contract is a contract between a credit institute and customer, which is based on the customer's request for opening a bank account of type Savings account and consists among others, account holder, general terms and conditions.
Comment: A bank account based on a Savings account contract is an account that allows money to be held on behalf of the account holder

columns.name: UUID
columns.description: An universal unique identifier of a bank account contract. Example: 01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An identifier of a bank account contract.

columns.name: CurrencyCode
columns.description: A CurrencyCode specifies the currency of the bank account contract. Example: EUR

columns.name: BankAccountIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A BankAccount is a bank account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank account contract. Example: 2

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: DormancyStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the dormancy status of a bank account contract. Example: 01

columns.name: DormancyStatusName
columns.description: Name of DormancyStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: UsageNote
columns.description: A comment on the usage of the current account contract.

columns.name: SystemAdministrativeData
columns.description: SystemAdministrativeData is administrative data that is stored in a system. This data includes change dates and change times.

columns.name: AccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A party which legally holds a Bank Account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: Product
columns.description: A Product describes the (financial) product upon which the bank account contract is based.

columns.name: BusinessEventRecord
columns.description: A record of a business event that changes a bank account contract.

columns.name: OperationalBankContractManagement
columns.description: An OperationalBankContractManagement is responsible for managing operational bank contracts and executing the related banking processes.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: A ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 20191122135035.7818490

columns.name: WithdrawalEarningsAvailabilityDuration
columns.description: An EarningsAvailabilityDuration is the period of time during which earnings are available for withdrawal by the account holder. Example: P1M

columns.name: WithdrawalAllowanceRule
columns.description: An AllowanceRule is a rule for granting allowance to the account holder to withdraw an amount from the bank account of a savings account contract without prior notice.

columns.name: CreateDraftRequestedIndicator
columns.description: Indicates whether the savings account contract shall be created with life cycle status code 'Draft Entered'.

tables.name: TimeDepositContract
tables.description:
A Time Deposit Contract is a contract between a credit institute and customer, which is based on the customer's request for opening a bank account of type time deposit and consists among others, account holder, general terms and conditions.
Comment: A bank account based on a time deposit contract is an account that allows money to be held on behalf of the account holder

columns.name: ID
columns.description: An identifier of a bank account contract.

columns.name: CurrencyCode

columns.name: BankAccountIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A BankAccount is a bank account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the life cycle status of a bank account contract. Example: 2

columns.name: LifeCycleStatusName
columns.description: Name of LifeCycleStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: DormancyStatusCode
columns.description: A coded representation of the dormancy status of a bank account contract. Example: 01

columns.name: DormancyStatusName
columns.description: Name of DormancyStatusCode. Example: Active

columns.name: UsageNote
columns.description: A comment on the usage of the current account contract.

columns.name: SystemAdministrativeData
columns.description: SystemAdministrativeData is administrative data that is stored in a system. This data includes change dates and change times.

columns.name: AccountHolderPartyIdentifyingElements
columns.description: A party which legally holds a Bank Account associated with the bank account contract.

columns.name: Product
columns.description: A Product describes the (financial) product upon which the bank account contract is based.

columns.name: BusinessEventRecord
columns.description: A record of a business event that changes a bank account contract.

columns.name: OperationalBankContractManagement
columns.description: An OperationalBankContractManagement is responsible for managing operational bank contracts and executing the related banking processes.

columns.name: BusinessProcessChainAssignment
columns.description: Business Process Chain Assignment is the assignment of a business object node to a business process chain.

columns.name: ChangeStateID
columns.description: A ChangeStateID is a unique identifier for a change state. Example: 20191122135035.7818490

columns.name: TermSpecification
columns.description: A specification of term elements that affects all term agreements of the deposit account contract.
